meanings.definition: Done with the hand brought forward and down from above the level of the shoulder.
meanings.sent1: He overhand tossed the ball to his friend.
meanings.sent2: She always prefers to throw the ball overhand.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to overhand swipe at the toy but missed hilariously.
meanings.sent4: The chef's overhand chopping of vegetables was swift and precise.
meanings.sent5: The teacher demonstrated the correct way to overhand write on the whiteboard.

meanings.definition: A throw or stroke made overhand.
meanings.sent1: His overhand was powerful and accurate in the game.
meanings.sent2: The coach praised her overhand technique during practice.
meanings.sent3: The overhand of the clock seemed to tick louder in the silent room.
meanings.sent4: The overhand of fate guided the outcome of the match.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes had a unique overhand that set her paintings apart.
